ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: nor does he speak from whim.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Neither does he speak of his own will.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: nor does he speak out of his desire.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: He does not speak out of his own desires.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And he does not say anything by his own desire.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Nor does he speak of desire.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Nor does he speak out of desire.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: nor speaks he out of caprice.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Nor doth he speak of (his own) desire.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: nor does he speak out of his own desire.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And he speaketh not of his own desire.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Nor does he speak out of [his own] desire:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Nor does he say (aught) of (his own) Desire.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Nor does he speak of (his own) desire.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: nor does he speak out of desire.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Nor does he speak out of desire.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Nor does he speak from [his own] inclination.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [53:3] nor does he, in regard to what he brings you, speak out of [his own] desire, [out of] the whims of his soul.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Nor doth he speak of (his own) desire) he did not utter the Qur'an of his own desire.
